projectName: All the projects with the Ministry of Investment, Egypt
desc: While I was working at the ministry I developed various projects for internal use at the ministry and some other for the benefit of the minister. I worked for around 4 projects at this time, 3 of them were web-based composed of basic CRUD applications and the last project was a desktop application querying a database for something personal for the minister.
role: I was a software developer, developing web and desktop applications. My tasks were doing software design, database design, software implementation and software testing. I used to report to the software development manager.

client: ADSIC (Abu Dhabi Systems and Information Center)
desc: Luckily this project is still online. It is a map viewer for Abu Dhabi Municipality that integrates with Abu Dhabi’s SDI
role:
This project was my first GIS project and it was in a very critical time when I joined it, it was late and the client was quite dissatisfied. Despite being a new hire, I left a very good impression in my induction period and I was asked to join this project.
I was reporting to the Software Team Lead, I was responsible for developing new functionalities, fixing defects, and deployments.

projectName: Cleaning management system for Hasa Municipality
client: Hasa Municipality, KSA (Kingdom of Saudi Arabia)
desc: The project was about creating a GIS application for Hasa Municipality in KSA to automate the cleaning activities around the city including mobility, task force, and incidents/violations.
role: I was reporting to the Software Team Lead. My tasks were to develop modules in the application, unit testing and fixing development and deployment defects.

desc: The project comprises integrated software and hardware infrastructure which utilizes the latest geospatial technologies in resources tracking, emergency call taking, and dispatching police units to crime scenes instantly.
role: I was reporting to the Software Team Lead. Developed various front-end functions in CallTaking module and Mapviewer module, and fixed bugs throughout all modules of the project.

client: Jeddah Municipality, KSA (Kingdom of Saudi Arabia)
desc: ECP is a cadastral GIS system involved in the operations of land services and integrates with several systems in the municipality.
role: Key member in the design and implementation phases in the project. I was based in the site in KSA so as to handle the deployment, integration with external systems, also to conduct the operation support.

projectName: Project Tracking for MEW (Ministry of Electricity and Water)
client: Ministry of Electricity and Water, Kuwait
desc: A GIS application enables projects’ tracking in terms of progress, geolocalization, and control accessibility, assignments and other various attributes.
role: Participated in application design, and developed several modules (front-end and back-end) in the application, was reporting to the software development manager.

desc: The project was to showcase the masterplan of the health facilities in Qatar and display the projection data of the five-year and eight-year plan. The application part of the project was mainly about displaying reports and dashboards for higher management.
role: This project was late before it started therefore in these 4 months I was working a lot of extra hours to get everything done in time. I reported directly to the project manager, I was responsible for the application front-end and back-end and I was also supervising a junior developer.

projectName: ADSIC Geospatial Executive Dashboard- Abu Dhabi
client: ADSIC (Abu Dhabi Systems and Information Center)
desc: The project was composed of two parts an executive dashboard based on projects executed in Abu Dhabi municipality and a project reporting tool targeted to the project managers to log project statuses and other information.
role:
Troubleshooting system in an early stage of the system operation where high availability is a key non-functional requirement, fixing functional, performance, and deployment bugs were also my responsibility.
I reported to the project manager and I was based on-site.

client: AD TCA (Abu Dhabi Tourism and Culture Authority)
desc: Dashboard for the top management of ADTCA to monitor and visualize many performance indicators related to or affecting Abu Dhabi tourism.
role: Developed various functions in the system, the system was designed in a way to be a base for a configurable application for similar types of projects. I was the main developer, was also responsible for leading junior developers, deployments, user training.

desc: I was hired as an individual outsource to designing and implement the geodatabase required for the GIS infrastructure of Aldar, along with configuring/developing a web mapping application using Portal for ArcGIS, Web App Builder.
role: Reported to the GIS Manager at Aldar.

projectName: Review and Development of Kuwait Municipality GIS
desc: Development of Kuwait Municipality GIS including workflow automation through different departments of the Municipality.
role: Creating Web GIS and integrating with the current infrastructure, and developing senior management's dashboard for monitoring the progress and task force.

desc: With another classmate as we have programming background we chose to skip the course and instead develop an application that proves our skills. The application is a utility for rating and querying CSR (Corporate Social Responsibility) for companies.
role: My classmate and I decided to learn from each other to get the most out of this project. I learnt a lot about how to work on Github and on my part I was involved in all the development, front-end and back-end.

desc:
Developed various projects using, and other Esri tools and services that solve GIS problems locally in the city of Castellón, Spain
One of the projects using Story Maps and the final project was about creating a dynamic street network using ArcGIS Desktop, ArcGIS Server and Geoprocessing Tools.
role: Individual Projects

desc: Using an online API for movies to display/search for the Now playing and Top movies in a list and a map based on their production location.
role: Individual Project

desc: A Console application to do unsupervised image classification on satellite images.
role: Individual Project

desc: Development of an application with which you can create TODO notes on a map.
role: Leading the team and advising other team members while responsible for the back-end.

desc: Developing a spatial analysis R package that predicts the tip payment patterns on weekdays and weekends using New York’s green taxi data.
role: Leading the team and advising other team members while responsible for the back-end.

projectName: Active Bubo (Analysis of Bubo Owl Movement)
desc: Analysing the movement data of the Horned Owl (Bubo Owl) to understand when is the time around the year when it is most active.
role: Leading the team, breaking down tasks, supporting team and documentation.

desc: Development of an application that predicts the number of bikes that pass through bike monitor stations around the city of Münster, Germany.
role: Leading the work in the Front-end and Back-end development.

desc: A online portfolio showing my experience interactively on a leaflet map based on a JSON experience file.
role: Individual Project

employer: The Master of Science in Geospatial Technologies (http://mastergeotech.uji.es/)
desc: As a formal requirement to complete the master of science in geospatial technologies, my class and I organized GeoMundus conference.
role: I was the leader of the web team, conference moderator, and I led a workshop during the conference about open source geospatial technologies.
